proper noun.description: (c.1829–1909), Apache chief; Apache name Goyathlay. He resisted white encroachment on tribal lands in Arizona by leading his people in raids on settlers and US troops before he surrendered in 1886.

exclamation.description: Used to express exhilaration, especially when leaping from a great height or moving at a high speed.

origin: Second World War: by association with Geronimo, adopted as a slogan by American paratroopers.
